alert.note: Alert for Deaf Smith; Randall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 10:23PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Randall and east central Deaf Smith Counties through 1100 PM CDT... At 1023 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Umbarger, or 11 miles west of Canyon, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Amarillo, Canyon, Mescalero Park, Buffalo Lake, Dawn, Umbarger and Timbercreek Canyon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
